properties.name: Your Name
properties.description: Your Name (Japanese: 君の名は。) is a 2016 Japanese animated romantic fantasy film, written and irected by Makoto Shinkai. It depicts a high school boy in Tokyo and a high school girl in the Japanese countryside who suddenly and inexplicably begin to swap bodies. The film grossed over ¥41.44 billion (US$382 million) worldwide, breaking numerous box office records, including becoming the third highest-grossing anime film of all time

properties.name: The National Art Center, Tokyo
properties.description: The National Art Center, Tokyo was founded in 2007 with the mission of contributing to the creation of a new culture that advances mutual understanding and inclusion through the power of art.

properties.name: Suga Shrine 須賀神社
properties.description: The shrine near the stairs where Mitsuha and Taki finally meet at the end of the movie.

properties.name: Hida City Library 飛驒市図書館
properties.description: The library where Taki and his friends did research about the comet and the town of Itomori.
